intro: Hemichroa diandra, commonly known as the African star grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a circular pattern, giving it a star-like appearance. It is typically found in grasslands and along riverbanks, thriving in well-drained soils. Hemichroa diandra is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
